definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: But Congress may by a vote of two-thirds of each House, remove such disability.
sentences.chinese: 但国会可以每院三分之二的票数取消此项限制。

sentences.english: I have won more of the popular vote than Senator Clinton. I have more delegates than Senator Clinton.
sentences.chinese: 我比克林顿参议员赢得了更多的党内代表的票数。

sentences.english: A decision to restitute gold requires support from an 85 percent majority of the total voting power.
sentences.chinese: 归还黄金要求得到总投票权的85%的票数支持。

sentences.english: Noda's the second highest number of votes immediately attracted the audience breathless.
sentences.chinese: 野田的这一第二高得票数顿时引来台下的惊叹声。

sentences.english: A solicitation of votes or orders.
Haiti announces vote tally recheck to stem unrest.
sentences.chinese: 海地宣布复检大选票数以抑制社会骚乱。

sentences.english: The presidential race is decided by a state-by-state tally of electoral votes.
sentences.chinese: 总统竞选按各州选举人票的票数决定。

sentences.english: Patrik Berger was your clear winner after amassing 48 per cent of the overall vote.
sentences.chinese: 博格得到总票数的48%成为你投票的最大的赢家。

sentences.english: The bill was passed by close votes in the House and Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案在参众两院以非常接近的票数获得了通过。

sentences.english: Each question takes up a proportion of the graph relative to its total of votes.
sentences.chinese: 每个问题占了图形相对于总投票数的部分比例。

sentences.english: When you compare reputation scores and votes, things get more interesting.
sentences.chinese: 当你比较荣誉值和投票数时，事情变得有趣起来。

sentences.english: Electoral officials tallied the results in front of the voters.
sentences.chinese: 负责选举的官员在投票人面前统计票数。

sentences.english: Mason had been overwhelmingly elected to the judgeship which he had so craved.
sentences.chinese: 梅森以压倒的票数当选他梦寐以求的法官。

sentences.english: By an overwhelming vote the Senate disagreed with the House motion.
sentences.chinese: 参议院以压倒优势的票数否决了众议院的动议。

sentences.english: That is why some neutrals hoped for a close result.
sentences.chinese: 这也是一些中间派希望票数接近的原因。

definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to campaign for votes/to ask voters for support
to read ballot slips out loud
